Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Evidence Statements: The student can show two people trying to communicate over a long distance.
The student can draw a simple device (like a string telephone) that uses sound to send and receive information between the two people.
The student can label the parts of the device that help it work, such as the cups and the string.
The student can demonstrate in the drawing how the device lets people communicate by showing the string stretched between the two cups.
The student can illustrate with arrows or labels how sound travels through the device from one person to the other.
The student can include and label any materials used to construct the device in their drawing, ensuring only the given materials are shown.
The student can visually represent how this device helps solve the problem of communicating over a distance.
